noun.description: The offspring of two plants or animals of different species or varieties, such as a mule (a hybrid of a donkey and a horse)
examples: a hybrid of wheat and rye

noun.description: A thing made by combining two different elements; a mixture.
examples: the final text is a hybrid of the stage play and the film

adjective.description: Of mixed character; composed of mixed parts.

origin: Early 17th century (as a noun): from Latin hybrida offspring of a tame sow and wild boar, child of a freeman and slave, etc.
